NOTES:

TM (04.12.2000 12:43:04)
	The behaviour I see is that a dialog asks whether the type should be moved to the package
	named "". This is correct modulo the rendering of the default package.

	The exception is thrown by the java model because it can't handle empty content.

TM (04.12.2000 14:33:56)
	Now using the JavaElement renderer for the package name. Moving to ITPJCORE.

DA (6/18/01 3:57:48 PM)
	Problem still exist in build 0.125.
Could not reproduce with 203.

In the console I got:
Log: Thu Oct 11 16:07:25 EDT 2001
4 org.eclipse.jdt.core 969 AssertionFailedError.java does not exist.

But no NPE.
Move to closed.
Move to closed.
It seems that the NPE is now either fixed or "simply" catched away. From a 
user's UI point of view the behavior is now correct, but I wouldn't expect log 
entries:

Log: Tue Oct 23 18:46:58 GMT+02:00 2001
4 org.eclipse.jdt.core 969 AssertionFailedError does not exist.
Log: Tue Oct 23 18:47:06 GMT+02:00 2001
4 org.eclipse.jdt.core 969 AssertionFailedError does not exist.

Why are they written to the log at all?
PRODUCT VERSION:
	JDT Mini Test Pass Nov 15, Eclipse 011, IBM JDK 1.2.2
